Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class TTombolaExamples

java.lang.Object
harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TTombolaExamples
public class TTombolaExamples
extends java.lang.Object
This class contains some methods showing how TombolaLib classes and functionalities should be accessed and used by client Java code. Basically, you will find here methods that generate series of cards, prepare (i.e. initialize) a tombola match and play or, if you prefer, simulate a game using such series. Of course methods here are simplify and only show 'default' behaviors and most used cases. But, together with Javadoc associated to this library, they will give you a fair starting point to start and experiment with TombolaLib.
Since:
1.8
Version:
1.1
Author:
Harry G. Potter (harry.g.potter@gmail.com)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    TGame getGameObject()
    Return the TGame object used by other methods within this object to demonstrate the use of the library and thus the simulation of a tombola match.
    TSeriesList getSeriesList()
    Return the TSeriesList object containing the series used by other example methods within this object.
    void initializeGame()
    This mathod shows how to instantiate and prepare a TGame object, that is the main object allowing the management (or simulation) of a tombola match.
    void mainGameLoop​(boolean randomResolve)
    This method shows how to use and interact with a TGame object to simulate and manage a tombola match. The main TGame method to iteratively call is the TGame.extractNumber(int) method. Checking its return code allows for taking proper action after the extraction of each number, until the game comes to the end.
    void prepareSampleSeriesSet​(int desiredSeries)
    This method shows how to basically use a factory objects (i.e. a tombolalib class instance implementing the ISetFactory interface) to generate a set of series of cards.

  • Method Details

    • getSeriesList

      public TSeriesList getSeriesList()
      Return the TSeriesList object containing the series used by other example methods within this object. Call prepareSampleSeriesSet(int) before, otherwise this method will return just a null value.
      Returns:
      the series list used by this object to demonstrate the library utilization.
      See Also:
      prepareSampleSeriesSet(int)

    • getGameObject

      public TGame getGameObject()
      Return the TGame object used by other methods within this object to demonstrate the use of the library and thus the simulation of a tombola match. Call this method after a call to initializeGame(), otherwise you will get just a null value.
      Returns:
      the game object used to demonstrate the library utilization.

    • prepareSampleSeriesSet

      public void prepareSampleSeriesSet​(int desiredSeries)
      This method shows how to basically use a factory objects (i.e. a tombolalib class instance implementing the ISetFactory interface) to generate a set of series of cards. This method illustrates also how to prepare a "custom" tombola logger object, that is an instance of TSimpleLogger class implementing the ILogger interface.
      Parameters:
      desiredSeries - the number of series you want to generate. Each series is composed by 6 cards using all 90 numbers.

    • initializeGame

      public void initializeGame()
      This mathod shows how to instantiate and prepare a TGame object, that is the main object allowing the management (or simulation) of a tombola match.

    • mainGameLoop

      public void mainGameLoop​(boolean randomResolve)
      This method shows how to use and interact with a TGame object to simulate and manage a tombola match. The main TGame method to iteratively call is the TGame.extractNumber(int) method. Checking its return code allows for taking proper action after the extraction of each number, until the game comes to the end.
      Parameters:
      randomResolve - is used to choose in which way the example must proceed when there are more than one cards candidate to win a prize after the same number extraction. pass true to let the exmple method proceed unattended, thus randomly chosing one winner among all the candidates cards, pass false to let the method stop and ask to the user on the standard console which card must be appointed.
